channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023070136
item.description:
Report E-2023070136

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was loading the trailer with gasoline. Due to a breach in the #1 compartment on the trailer, approximately 2229 gallons of gasoline was released. The spilled gasoline was isolated in the shipper's containment system. The shipper completed any necessary remediation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED DURING UNLOAD ON PRELOAD. BOX WAS COMPLETELY WET AND PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS. BOX CONTAINED 4 - 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF CONDENSER COIL CLEANER. DescribePack: PPLASTIC BOTTLES HAD LOSE CAPS AND WET AND ATE THROUGH ENTIRE BOX DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A HAZARDOUS PLASTIC BAG AND TOTE AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report E-2023070041
item.description:
Report E-2023070041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3266 Triple-D Universal Coil Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged pail and impacted cardboard and debris were neutralized with sodium bicarb and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070022
item.description:
Report E-2023070022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Allied International Emergency was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft- by-10ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging eighteen (18) 1-gallon plastic jugs. Allied International Emergency personnel separated the non-damaged plastic jugs and placed them on the side to be shipped onto the consignee. Allied International Emergency personnel neutralized the impacted area and deployed granular absorbents to collect the released material. Allied International Emergency personnel gathered all spent material and debris placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The impacted pallet was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The empty plastic jugs were placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023061597
item.description:
Report X-2023061597

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by PM QA at end of their shift. Hazmat was not declared and was wet at bottom. No markings or labels on package. Was only identified as a Hazmat when QA looked up product for damage report. Left isolated from others until full investigation on what to do next. DescribePack: 1 bottle ruptured inside and cracked; cause from extreme heat and poor packaging of reusing old box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from VSA and the belt.

item.title: Report E-2023060800
item.description:
Report E-2023060800

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3082 CRODATERIC CAS 50-LQ-(MH) release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor and a 20' x 24' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.
